original_text: My people have done two evil things: I give them life, like a spring of fresh water, but they have turned away from me. Instead, they have tried to get water for themselves. They have dug holes in the ground to store it. But those holes cannot hold the water. It quickly runs away. My people have done two evil things: I give them life, like a spring of fresh water, but they have turned away from me. Instead, they have tried to get water for themselves. They have dug holes in the ground to store it. But those holes cannot hold the water. It quickly runs away. My people have done two evil things:
korean_text: 내 백성이 두 가지 악을 행하였나니 곧 그들이 생수의 근원되는 나를 버린 것과 스스로 웅덩이를 판 것인데 그것은 그 물을 가두지 못할 터진 웅덩이들이니라

sentences.original_text: My people have done two evil things:
sentences.korean_translation: 내 백성이 두 가지 악한 일을 행하였도다

sentences.original_text: I give them life, like a spring of fresh water,
sentences.korean_translation: 내가 그들에게 생수 샘 같은 생명을 주었으나

sentences.original_text: but they have turned away from me.
Instead, they have tried to get water for themselves.
sentences.korean_translation: 대신 그들은 스스로 물을 얻으려 하였도다

sentences.original_text: They have dug holes in the ground to store it.
sentences.korean_translation: 그들은 물을 저장하기 위해 땅에 웅덩이를 팠도다

sentences.original_text: But those holes cannot hold the water.
sentences.korean_translation: 그러나 그 웅덩이는 물을 담지 못하도다
